alert.note: Alert for Union (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 9:47AM EST until January 11 at 1:00PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Jersey, including the following counties, Bergen, Essex, Passaic and Union. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 947 AM EST, emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Paterson, Wayne, Bloomfield, Orange, Ridgewood, Millburn, Ramsey, Pompton Lakes, Caldwell, Hawthorne, Fairfield, Clifton, East Orange, Irvington, West Orange, Montclair, Fair Lawn, Livingston, Maplewood and Hillside. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
